meta.description: Core template with static definitions
meta.title: AdA Core Template package

annotation.content: I don't know. Just... reading advice columns. I wanna be as complicated as all these people.
How can you tell something is wrong?
I don't know. I just can.
I don't know. I have a lot of dreams about my ex-wife Catherine. We were friends like we used to be. We're not gonna be together and we're not together but... we're friends, still. She's not angry.
I think I hid myself from her. Left her alone in the relationship.
Hm... Why haven't you gotten divorced yet?
I don't know. For her it's just a piece of paper, it doesn't mean anything.
I'm not ready. I like being married.
Yeah, but you haven't... really been together for almost a year.
You don't know what it's like to lose someone you care about.
O, Theodore. That's hard... You're hungry?
You wanna try getting out of bed? Mopy? Come on! You can still wallow in your misery, just do it while you're getting dressed.
Alright, I'm getting up, I'm getting up!
Up, up, up, up, up! Come on, out!
Alright, alright, I'm up, I'm up!
Keep walking. Keep walking. And - stop! Now, turn around 260 degrees, slower, slower, good, ok and stop.
Ok, turn to your right, turn here, stop! Spin around. Keep going. Keep going! Stop. Now walk forward. Everyone thinks you're really drunk right now. And stop.
You want a coke with that?
soft musical illustration of emotions which accentuates the emotional changing from sad to happy
Party 1: intro (moody piano chords and melody)
Part 2: acceleration (broken chords played by electronic synthesizer, varying by only one step of one note)
soft musical illustration of emotions which accentuates the emotional changing from sad to happy
Part 1: intro (moody piano chords and melody)
Part 2: acceleration (broken chords played by electronic synthesizer, varying by only one step of one note)
Part 1: intro (moody piano chords and melody)
I'd like a slice of cheese, please.
Now say: I'd like a slice of cheese, please.
Walk forward. And stop and sneeze.
You're right... I keep waiting 'cause I care about her.

Following annotation of the same type

meta.description: Elementary schema
meta.dc:title: Basic schema

meta.description: A simple text annotation
meta.dc:title: Text annotation
Simple relation
meta.dc:description: Generic relation between two elementary annotations

meta.description: Dialogue is a transcription of understandable, spoken language that is dominant within the film. This is usally dialagoue from protagonists, off-commentary, but also chorus. Nonverbal utterances (e.g. laughing, coughing, stuttering) will not be transcribed in this basic version.
meta.title: Lg | Dialogue Text

meta.description: Text is the transcription of written language that is shown and highlighted within the film. This can be fixed subtitles, captions, intertitles, text on screens or logos.
meta.title: Lg | Text Diegetic

meta.value_metadata: {"extreme long shot": {"ontology_uri": "http://ada.filmontology.org/resource/2018/09/25/AnnotationValue/FieldSize_extreme_long_shot", "numeric_value": 1.0}, "long shot": {"ontology_uri": "http://ada.filmontology.org/resource/2018/09/25/AnnotationValue/FieldSize_long_shot", "numeric_value": 2.0}, "medium long shot": {"ontology_uri": "http://ada.filmontology.org/resource/2018/09/25/AnnotationValue/FieldSize_medium_long_shot", "numeric_value": 3.0}, "medium shot": {"ontology_uri": "http://ada.filmontology.org/resource/2018/09/25/AnnotationValue/FieldSize_medium_shot", "numeric_value": 4.0}, "medium closeup": {"ontology_uri": "http://ada.filmontology.org/resource/2018/09/25/AnnotationValue/FieldSize_medium_closeup", "numeric_value": 5.0}, "shoulder closeup": {"ontology_uri": "http://ada.filmontology.org/resource/2018/09/25/AnnotationValue/FieldSize_shoulder_closeup", "numeric_value": 6.0}, "closeup": {"ontology_uri": "http://ada.filmontology.org/resource/2018/09/25/AnnotationValue/FieldSize_closeup", "numeric_value": 7.0}, "extreme closeup": {"ontology_uri": "http://ada.filmontology.org/resource/2018/09/25/AnnotationValue/FieldSize_extreme_closeup", "numeric_value": 8.0}, "neither": {"ontology_uri": "http://ada.filmontology.org/resource/2018/09/25/AnnotationValue/FieldSize_neither", "numeric_value": 9.0}}
meta.completions: [TO],extreme long shot,long shot,medium long shot,medium shot,medium closeup,shoulder closeup,closeup,extreme closeup,neither
meta.description: The Field Size describes how much of the centred subject in a shot and its surrounding is visible and thereby establishes the distance/proximity of the spectator to the events. Besides human bodies the reference objects can also be other figures (e.g. animals, machines). In accordance with Faulstich 2002, Hickethier 2001, Mikos 2003 the spectrum of wide to near is divided into eight field sizes. Additionally there is a category for cases without a distinct reference object.
meta.title: ImCo | Field Size

meta.item_color: python:('white' if here.content.data=='bright' else ('grey' if here.content.data=='medium' else ('#404040' if here.content.data=='dark' else ('lightgrey' if here.content.data=='bright-dark' else 'lightgreen'))))
meta.description: The light intensity of a light source constitutes its brightness (Monaco 2000, 99) This category is a rough approximation of the perceived brigthness by the spectator aiming at filmintrinsic variations instead of absolute values.
meta.title: ImCo | Image Brightness

meta.item_color: python:('white' if here.content.data=='high' else ('grey' if here.content.data=='medium' else ('#404040' if here.content.data=='low' else 'lightgreen')))
meta.description: Contrast refers to the perceived degree of difference between the darkest and lightest areas of the frame. (See Bordwell & Thompson: Film Art. An Introduction (2008), 162.
meta.title: ImCo | Light Contrast

meta.description: Spatial spreading of the different colours across the screen. Description of the general pattern of a shot and its possible transformation over time.
meta.title: ImCo | Colour Composition

meta.item_color: python:('#FC9FBB' if here.content.data.startswith('low') else ('#CD5E68' if here.content.data.startswith('medium') else ('#FF004C' if here.content.data.startswith('high') else 'lightgreen')))
meta.description: Spatial spreading of the different colours across the screen. Description of the general pattern of a shot and its possible transformation over time.
meta.title: ImCo | Colour Saturation

meta.description: Simplified notation of the color range that is used in a sequence. For the purpose of comparability colors have to be picked from a reduced set of colors.
meta.title: ImCo | Colour Range

meta.description: Colour that stands out from the predominant range of colors and thus captures the attention of the viewers.
meta.title: ImCo | Colour Accent

meta.description: Texture is understood here as surface attribute of the filmic image itself and not of the represented surfaces. These textures can refer to the media formats the images originate from.
meta.title: ImCo | Texture

meta.description: Proportional relationship between the heigth and the width of the image. In case of a split-screen sequence multiple aspect ratios can be named.
meta.title: ImCo | Aspect Ratio

meta.description: For the viewer perceivable modulation of time that results (potentially) from the relation between recording and playback rate (see Bordwell & Thompson 2008, 166)
meta.title: Cam | Recording/Playback Speed

meta.description: impression of the depth of field in which objects are sharp in an image
meta.title: Cam | Depth Of Field

meta.description: Ability of the frame to be mobile as camera movement. A mobile frame is usually achieved by moving the camera physically during production or digitally on a virtual set. There are several kinds of camera movement, with a specific effect onscreen. Different types of camera movement can occur at the same time (e.g. Vertigo Zoom - zooming-in while moving the camera away). See Bordwell & Thompson: Film Art. An Introduction (2008), 195
meta.title: Cam | Camera Movement Type

meta.description: Relative movement speed of the camera.
meta.title: Cam | Camera Movement Speed

meta.description: Direction of the camera movement. Order of the values describes the temporal succession of the movement.
meta.title: Cam | Camera Movement Direction

meta.description: Perspective that the camera takes towards the central reference object on the vertical level.
meta.title: Cam | Camera Angle

meta.description: Ability of the frame to be mobile as camera movement. A mobile frame is usually achieved by moving the camera physically during production or digitally on a virtual set. There are several kinds of camera movement, with a specific effect onscreen. Different types of camera movement can occur at the same time (e.g. Vertigo Zoom - zooming-in while moving the camera away). See Bordwell & Thompson: Film Art. An Introduction (2008), 195
meta.title: Cam | Camera Movement Type IMPORTED

meta.description: Relative movement speed of the camera.
meta.title: Cam | Camera Movement Speed IMPORTED

meta.description: Duration of a shot. A Shot of a film is a perceivable continuous image and is bound by a discontinuation of the whole composition
meta.title: Montg | Shot Duration

meta.title: Montg | Montage Figure Micro

meta.description: Dynamics Of Space' describes the narrowing and widening of the imagespace (Kappelhoff 2005, 2007)
meta.title: Montg | Dynamics Of Space

meta.description: Basic classification of the mood that is communicated through the phonetic qualities of utterances. In case of mixed moods values are attributed to single characters by referencing them in brackets.
meta.title: As | Dialogue Emotion

meta.description: Typologisation of spoken words according to their diegetic status and their acoustic qualities. Utterances can be attributed to figures via tags.
meta.title: As | Dialogue Type

meta.description: Indication which acoustic level (music, language or sound) is in the centre of the viewers' attentention. This indication should thus provide indications which acoustic dynamics are decisive for the perception of the segment.
meta.title: As | Dominant Acoustic Level

meta.description: Rough classification of the represented image content, that is perceived as central to the shot.
meta.title: Motf | Image Content

meta.description: Sound enveloppe
meta.title: Sound enveloppe
